results.title: If a boy can't learn
results.creator_credit: Lawrence A Williams, Susan S Trout and Lawren Productions
results.brief_description: Looks at the problem of a boy with learning disabilities, who is sent to a Learning Disabilities Center for diagnostic workup and testing. A specialist confers with the boy’s teachers and together they improvise ways of teaching to his strengths in order to compensate for his disabilities and help him learn. Excellent for teacher training and can be valuable to parents.

results.title: Identifying speech disorders: language (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Glen Howard, James Craig and Bay State Film Productions
results.brief_description: One of a series of films which portrays a type of deviant communication. It is limited to a descriptive presentation of language disorders which allow the individual instructor to discuss cause, treatment, prognosis etc., according to his own perspective.

results.title: Ideas for you
results.creator_credit: Joe Scully and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Productivity ideas are vital to progress in Australian industry. Productivity groups of twelve or more meet regularly to exchange ideas. A new method of coating earth moving equipment, new fixing cement, a shortened cycle in washing machines, an insulated container for freighting dry ice, and a new method of packing poultry, are some results of the group’s activities.

results.title: Ideas at work
results.brief_description: This film demonstrates how skilled workers may be freed from unnecessary labour by the use of simple mechanical devices and for rearrangement of personnel. As the result of employee suggestions for improvements, labour and time saving devices are adopted, leading to increased production. Such increased productivity can lead to shorter hours and higher wages.

results.title: ICI la France: Les Lyceens chez eux
results.creator_credit: Mary Glasgow, Donald Carter and Associated Television
results.brief_description: French language training film - all dialogue is in French. A visit to the modern Lycee at Enghien where the curriculum includes practical work, a lot of sport and where the pupils can pursue their own chosen activities such as painting as well as participating in the organisation of the school through an elected committee. Several pupils and teachers are introduced and a lesson Ronsard is shown.

results.title: Icelandic
results.creator_credit: Eric Johnson and Icelandic Freezing Plant Corporation
results.brief_description: The frozen fish industry in Iceland. The ocean conditions that produce Iceland’s fishing grounds; the difficult ocean conditions around Iceland and the life of the fishermen; how the catch is processed; how to cook frozen fish. Also shows Iceland’s stark landscape and how her people depend upon the fishing industry.

results.title: Ice birds
results.creator_credit: Marc Hebert, Marc Beaudet and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Crystal Pillar, White Lady, The Whale—these are the names given by ice-climbing enthusiasts to the spectacular ice formations surrounding Quebec’s Montmorency Falls. Ice Birds shows two experienced climbers scaling the breathtaking wall of the Crystal Pillar with precision and considerable daring, appearing from below as black spots on the vast landscape of one of nature’s masterpieces. Film without words

results.title: Ice and water: a case study
results.creator_credit: Andrew Millington, BBC-TV and Open University
results.brief_description: A case study of the ice/water system. Considers: the two properties of the ice/water system, the odd density variation with temperature and the fact that ice melts at zero degrees centigrade when subject to a high pressure. (Solids, liquids and gases series; unit 16)

results.title: Icarus = Icare
results.creator_credit: Paul Bochner, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The Greek myth retold by film animation, accompanied by music for flute written by Eldon Rathburn. Music, drawing, colour and movement here follow a moving classic restraint. Daedalus, inventor of many things, provides the wings to escape from Crete but Icarus, his son, impetuously flies too high. In this film, artist and composer share equal pleasure in the telling, with a feeling the audience will share. A film without words. Award: Oberhausen
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Bochner, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: The Icarus wish
results.brief_description: The awe of flight, the wonder of a bird, the freedom of riding a current of air. Multiple screen images condense the emotions of two boys of different cultures. A jet liner, a bird, a kite and a paper airplane are the segments of this non-verbal adventure in visual literacy.
